intro: Draconia capillaris, commonly known as the slender dragonroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It features a slender, wiry stem that grows upright, often reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, arranged in a rosette at the base of the plant. Draconia capillaris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
